title: Worth Seeing
text: Ancient theatre that looks beautiful. It must have being amazing in it's day. The design is still the same we use today. Entry to this is on the same ticket as the Acropolis. We purchased a ticket that allowed us to visit 7 sites for 30 Euros. Good place to visit and the view up the top is amazing.

title: Brilliant Views
text: Brilliant views of the whole city. Buy a ticket to see 7 attractions for 60 euro. Also under 25's go free, but proof of age is needed.. Athens not good on sign posting entrances, so you end up walk around in circles.

title: worth seeing
text:
We purchased a ticket to see 7 site for 60 euros. Children. under 25 go free, but you do need them to have proof.
Athens attractions are badly sign posted, so you do spend time looking for the way in.

title: Great
text: Interesting place and unique in it's own way. Lots of rubble, which is nothing unusual for Athens. Athens is easy to get around, find a hotel in the centre and you can walk to most sites. Buy a pass to visit 7 places for 60 euros. Also children under 25 go free, but make sure they can prove this.

title: Great Location
text: Great Location, you can walk to most of the tourist sites. Hotel staff very helpful and friendly. Breakfast excellent. Rooms could do with decorations, specially the bathrooms, they were a bits of mould around the bath and the shower didn't work very well in our room

title: Brilliant place for an evening out
text: We have visited this theatre regularly for the last 10 years. I have very rarely been disappointed. On a Friday you can have an evening meal and then watch a fantastic performance. On par with WestEnd performances. Staff and actors very friendly and all pitch in to helps as waiting staff. We have already booked four more nights out for this year. In the summer you can take a picnic with you and enjoy the beautiful garden

title: Brilliant 10CC
text:
I have watched several concerts, plays and panto at this theatre over 25 years.
It a great place to visit. Excellent performances, good seating and great view of stage. Parking very near and if you visit in the evening not very expensive to park. Numerous restaurants to eat at before the show, there ia also a restaurant at the theatre. Bear in mind the restaurant is not open on a Sunday.

title: Great Place for Afternoon Tea
text:
Voucher given to me by a friend as a Birthday gift.
They were very friendly, we had an extra guest with us and they were happy for us the share and only pay extra for the small amount the other guest had extra. Would recommended and visit again

title: Good Meal
text:
enjoyed are visit, went with friends who had been there before.
Service was excellent, very friendly staff

title: Beautiful
text: Well worth a visit, outside is just as beautiful as inside. different time periods the city has gone through.
place: Museum of the History of Bologna

title: Brilliant Toasted Sandwiches
text: We just happened to walk past and then went back the next day again hoping it would be open on a Sunday and it was. Very small shop with a few tables and chairs, You can sit outside but February's a bit cold. They sell Beer, soft Drinks and Coffee but NO TEA or hot chocolate. The toasties are brilliant we had the Pearl Habor and Armageddon. Great variety of toasties. Bonus you can charge your phone while you eat. Excellent service. Highly recommended.

title: A Must See
text: Great place to look around. Lots of Bargains. Here you can find practically anything for sale from clothes, shoes, fashion accessories, flowers, pottery and jewellery.

title: Beautifully Basilica
text: Well worth a look. Free. I only gave it 4star because it was very cold inside compared to outside and so we may have rushed around it. Soldiers were standing guard at the entrance so you do feel maybe you are not allowed in but they are fine.

title: A Must See
text: Located at the main square is the town hall, which is free to enter. Very usual staircase which I am told is ideal for horses to use. We spent well over 1 hour walking around it to different rooms. Make sure you visit

title: Worth it
text:
Climb up the tower. The panoramic view is marvellous.
Buy your tickets from in Piazza Maggiore at the tourist point with appointment. 5€/ticket.
place: Le Due Torri Torre degli Asinell

title: Great Place to Stay
text: We were made very welcome on arrival. We arrived early and our room wasn’t yet available, so were offered the room on the ground floor, which was idea. Situated in the city centre and turn right out of the hotel and 20 second walk to the main via indipendenza, which has all the well know shops plus loads of places to eat. Walk straight on and you come to several interesting buildings.Turn left from the hotel and at the bottom of the road is a supermarket for anyone like me who likes to snack on something in the evenings. Most attractions are in walking distance. The staff at the hotel and very friendly and every request is dealt with efficiently and with a smile. It was cold when we visited this February but the hotel temperature was very comfortable. The room was clean and even had a kettle, which made me very happy.. Breakfast was continental, with plenty of choice. I have looked at some of the negative reviews and find them all very strange. Yes there is a Lingerie shop next door but I did not see anything offensive and also most of Bologna is covered with graffiti. The road is narrow but very safe.

title: Great Food
text:
Wonderful food and serve. A very varied menu. Something for everyone.
You can eat at the bar as well as the restaurants

title: Interesting
text: On a good day well worth the walk. You can have a caricatureson done on the bridge. Lots of status etc.

title: Worth a Visit
text:
Beautiful place. You can go inside and walk around FOC but if you want to go into the builders you need to buy a ticket and that does get confusing. Make sure you ask then before buying.
Lots of choices of tickets. Euros are accepted in some place but make sure you take Czech money

title: Great
text: The Old Town is beautiful and so is the clock. It rings on the hour and hundreds of tourist stand around waiting for the hour, which is slightly disappointing, not much happens.
place: Old Town Hall with Astronomical Clock

title: Really Great
text:
Food was wonderful. service excellent. Would recommend.
The room was beautiful, we had pre-booked and it was really worth it.

title: Really Great
text: it may be a little expense but really enjoyed it and we won 7 crystals. But you don't get anything at the end unless you buy a crystal £10. Staff are wonderful and the games were fun.
place: The Crystal Maze LIVE Experience London

title: Great
text: Comfortable seating with more room upstairs, Good location in the heart of Swaffham. Good food, with a nice selection of different dishes. What more do you need.

title: Excellent
text:
Have eaten at the Windmill in Necton many times of the last 25 years.
Never been disappointed. You should give it a try.

title: Great Place
text:
A little strange that there was no one at reception but a note left on a board with your name and number of your room with the key in the door . No sign outside for the B&B.
We arrive at night so could not make out were the entrance to the B&B was.
Apart from that lovely place and the breakfast was wonderful. Rooms comfortable.
Please note that there is a Indian Restaurants next to the entrance this will help finding it.

title: Wonderful
text:
60th Birthday bash with about 70 family/friends. Wonderful evening, staff very friendly.
Food was great, the carvery was an excellent idea. Plenty of parking. Beautifully decorated room. Would recommend. Thank you Lizzie and her team.

title: Great Place
text:
Check in was very easy at the main hotel we had been given instructions on how to get there. One of the staff then took us to the apartment which was only 2 minutes The apartment was spacious and well decorated with good facilities. Three bedrooms and two bathrooms on two floors. Good size kitchen but on oven. Supermarkets near by.
This apartment is in a very good location. Good toiletries provided. You do have to pay extra for cleaning.

title: Great
text: Beautiful square, with some interesting buildings. We went in December, it was raining but still fine the walk around, Less people in the winter and not so smelly.

title: Excellent
text:
Went on a Thursday night with six other friends. First ever visit it was very busy.
Food was excellent. My Halloumi starter was delicious. Everyone in our party enjoyed their meal. It has recently been refurbished and looked wonderful. I look forward to visiting again

title: Theatre Night
text: Small cosy theatre, Good amature production. Saw a Alan Bennett production, the main actor was not able to attend so another actor took his place and had to read from a script all thru. But that did not spoil anything, he was the best on stage, how he kept this up I do not know.

title: Excellent location
text:
The hotel is in a great location not to far from the Parliment Building. We stay for 5 days between Christmas and New Year. We enjoy walking so had no problem getting around on foot. Free WiFi. We had breakfast included and the choice was plentyful.
Tea and coffee, hairdryer and safe available in the room. Close to main street so plenty of places to eat and shop, including Spar supermarkets on most corners. Staff friendly.Station five mins. Behind station large Shopping Mall with all you favourite shops. Would visit again.

title: Great
text: Worth a Visit. Tours available in several languages. Busy in December so heave knows what it's like in the summer

title: Nice Walk
text: Make sure you wrap up warm in the winter months, can get very windy. The vire are lovely. Well worth a walk on both sides

title: Very Interesting
text: Learn the history, hear the hungarians tell their stories. Very sad how awful the Germans and Russians were.

title: Christmas Meal
text:
We had not been before, visited with 8 other friends. We had a fantastic meal, good wine and excellent service - can't ask for more. Recommend you pay the Ugly Bug a visit.
Would go back.

title: Hotel in Heart of Lisbon
text:
The front of this hotel is a beautiful art- deco. Inside its comfortable. Our home had a kitchenette (toaster, kettle, fridge, microwave,two ring hob, dishwasher etc, which was idea for Breakfast. It are its central location from which you get anywhere, either on foot or by metro station just in front of hotel and the stunning panorama of Lisbon from the top floor bar, which you must visit. Hard Rock Cafe opposite. Rooms very clean and a good size.
Staff very friendly and helpful.
Yellow bus very useful if staying for only a couple of days, you can hop off and on.
View from Castle excellent, local will say its to far to walk too, but its not, just slightly steep.
Hotel website mentions free WIFI but this is not the case and when we were there it was not working.
We visited in December weather very good.

title: Great
text:
Went to a wedding reception at Sun Pavillion
Lovely place prefect for a wedding
The food was excellent
Staff very friendly
